decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - No part of the advertisement units hereby permitted shall be retained after two years of the date of consent. At that time, the said advertisements shall be permanently removed from the site, unless any express consent has been granted for their retention thereafter.
Condition : 2 - No advertisement shall be displayed without the consent of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission.

Condition : 3 - No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as to -
(a) endanger persons using any highway, railway, waterway, dock, harbour or aerodrome (civil or military);
(b) obscure, or hinder the ready interpretation of, any traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air; or
(c) hinder the operation of any device used for the purpose of security or surveillance or for measuring the speed of any vehicle.
Condition : 4 - Any advertisement displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements, shall be maintained in a condition that does not impair the visual amenity of the site.
Condition : 5 - Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a condition that does not endanger the public.
Condition : 6 - Where an advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the site shall be left in a condition that does not endanger the public or impair visual amenity.
Condition : 7 - The maximum luminance for the advertisements shall not exceed 400cd/sqm during the day and 300cd/sqm from dusk to dawn.

Condition : 8 - The displays on the all the panels shall be static and two dimensional only, with no moving or apparently moving images, devices, wording or emblems, and shall not depict any images that resemble road signs or traffic signals unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 9 - The advertisements displayed on each panel shall not change more frequently than once every 20 seconds.
Condition : 10 - The site hoarding shown on the approved drawings must be fully erected prior to display of the advertisements.
description: Proposed amendment to condition 9 of 00505/EY/AD18 (which approved the erection of three internally illuminated hoardings and the removal of nine existing poster panel hoardings) dated 8 January 2014 to vary the timing of advertisement changes from not more than once every 30 seconds to not more than once every 20 seconds.
